2C597763248D4D7D80A0FC95F35343ED.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

A1AE7B0C990A40A2B57F97A1366A9730.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

4E65A1C41DAA4B3897D48B9362269211.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

43D5FF34879048E0B826A0C2248AFB46.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals

CDE2F6A5FD374CF19740E929222E48C8.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

19E7E52AC5B6464781FAC2B4134D07C8.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

8A52D7CF2A454E98BE407C1AF9500868.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

48EC02ADB7164A1293CF32029A5CF92E.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

B55A0860A1A642708DC619B8837F6415.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

7576C0A9E72A41629C0879701FE832B2.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

CEB812133E04449CB6B8A1876BE93FD7.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

D09AFEB14C3D4D95B25C740FAA9277C8.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

F71FCF19238D4F8BACBE457684FED6D7.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

97510B77B35F468F83B4B895E4209D67.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor? What should I wear?,  When will I be provided with safety training? What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement? Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?. What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

F5E161DE350347CCA2A6FBE6F6C11E97.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

0343D445A1AE424DA27F8FEF9F791861.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

C18205A9817A4DB1AFA3A829F4416D60.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

015026235CD346BD82CBDFA97098B9A2.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

162C913187C34E9A9631F928D8C3A75A.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

3635B96E921C4949964B4052F74F577D.description: Investigate how business impacts the local and global economy.

1FB4B44FCB46480C998A596E927E13AF.description: Analyze strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats from a managerial lens, given a variety of business scenarios.

94148607C0EB4581A605C7029222D028.description: Justify your business decisions (e.g., drop shipping and out sourcing) based on your personal and business ethics (e.g., sustainable business, child labour, cosmetics and animal testing, economic footprint, First Nations and Métis worldviews/land).

3D6E478E10304E7C9E9832F218952534.description: Engage in the inquiry questions: How do copyright laws impact business decisions? How do online stores challenge personal ethics?

601F734A5C6740008E4EC2E4C89740A5.description: Create a business proposal for a business (e.g., online business, small business, e-business) within an area of interest (e.g., delivery service, investment company, shoe store, sports team).

BEE7514BB6EF4B93A0592AA3BD6DCF54.description: Engage in an accounting project or simulation related to owning or operating a business.

4333FF4BA5A44814BF877B531285B7AB.description: Differentiate between journal entries and financial statements for a corporation, sole proprietorship and partnership.

7B0CC572FB2B465D861865C837C6350B.description: Prepare financial statements for a corporation

740D725FFFA44AD6B28FFE17210B5B1A.description: Calculate and prepare journal entries for a corporation.

54F654BA31294B11B2BD9A896255E744.description: Examine journal entries and financial statements for a corporation.

8DBEAA1A313C40EB8755CF1D392F7327.description: Journals and Financial Statements for Corporate Accounting (Optional)

6CECB20A61E947E9955694E5FF34E598.description: Discuss the accounting implications for dissolving a partnership and liquidating assets.

D689C92F11174AC798D214EA80D606AC.description: Compare journals and financial statements for a sole proprietorship to those for a partnership.

EDEA1A9602AD46D98C734E876DD4497E.description: Prepare financial statements for a partnership.

2C238690E5DD4949B35B060339C7CA85.description: Calculate and prepare journal entries for a partnership.

209FE99C03CD4F8CBC4494CA08E8FCB9.description: Construct journal entries and financial statements for a partnership.

9E13124667804C809A0FAEFC9E82F290.description: Journals and Financial Statements for Partnership (Optional)

AF1A8598535843D19FC35B84A69A97EC.description: Analyze scenarios (e.g., increased fertilizer or fuel expense, drop in livestock price) using farm records and justify actions to be taken the following year based on those records.

788986A417414E4799662022720E2BF1.description: Prepare a cash statement of farming income and expenses (i.e., income statement), a statement of net worth (i.e., balance sheet), and an accrual income statement from ledger accounts and the synoptic/combination journals.

39726369B8644A16B64CD310A202F9D8.description: Balance and post column totals of completed synoptic/combination journals to general and subsidiary ledger accounts.

8CFE526F11F4447DA937BFFB4427810B.description: Analyze and record transactions related to an agricultural setting into cash inflow and cash outflow synoptic/combination journals.

CE06021049A4432DAABE57A5FA536E95.description: Design and present column headings for the cash inflow and cash outflow synoptic/combination journals given transactions.

07D73CBB19124549937BE860D5720E5A.description: Analyze how transactions such as cash inflow, cash outflow and accounting software are recorded to keep accurate agricultural business records.

7CCB9140F93E4C82BCD85E7535AF2034.description: Recognize cash and accrual methods of accounting and describe the circumstances under which each may be used.

52A25C4B193C4C29B1FCFAF9C3CE1BFB.description: Distinguish between a synoptic/combination journal in an agricultural setting and a synoptic/combination journal created in a general business setting and describe the similarities and differences between these two books of original entry.

227394EF662848C8B7221CE21E482D23.description: Categorize farm business expenses (e.g., purchase of seed, insurance premiums, percentage of utility bills, repairs and maintenance, feed) and farm business income (e.g., sales from crops, refunds, livestock products).

56A7FFA32F0145F8ADE82C78CEF5B69C.description: Distinguish and sort farm financial information (e.g., vehicle, fuel, power, groceries, property tax, veterinary) into business and personal categories in preparation for journalizing.

F6EACC2601B94C0CA360929A85647E77.description: Review cash control principles and give examples of how those principles may be used in a farm setting.

C33667ED96D445498BFF38F2D0B274DB.description: Investigate accounting practices for agricultural business.

3724BD4572D1446E9F5850CB79FCE7D4.description: Differentiate between cash and accrual accounting systems used within agriculture.

9631B7C7914A4851B506B7ABB700C472.description: Discuss the benefits of different forms (e.g., sole proprietorship, corporation, partnership) of business ownership as applied to agriculture.

3799FB620A964407858B4BDE6EDCD2E5.description: Recognize forms (e.g., sole proprietorship, corporation, franchise, partnership, cooperative model) of business ownership and discuss the applications to agricultural settings.

6134FDEEB3AE4BF3B7626502217C496F.description: Examine business ownership as applied to agricultural industry.

496033895B9540DA86183CF7E1BF03BA.description: Examine the inquiry questions: Why keep records? Who should have access to records?

ED7233F6CA5349AAA53ACF7F10E50471.description: Compose a set of guidelines for ethical and fair accounting decisions in an agricultural application.

0600E55D0A9C4733A706B144168B1C3A.description: Examine how farm records are used to make decisions regarding operation (e.g., what to grow and when, diversification) and financial management (e.g., capital asset replacement, tax laws, estate planning tools, government programs, loan application) decisions.

ACF16D2FBE6B4680A6367CC7FBAE5977.description: Examine programs available through agencies/organizations such as Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada that support specific groups (e.g., farm with lower net worth, First Nations, corporations) working in the agriculture industry in Saskatchewan.

BF08A18DDF4244E9AC830A0EB5E6AD10.description: Investigate agencies/organizations (e.g., Saskatchewan Economic Development Corporation, Farm Credit Canada, Farm Syndicates Credit Act) and the available financial supports for agriculture credit and why accurate farm records are needed.

1CE8FE1245AA4F07B06E7F223B1574B7.description: Discuss the role that insurance agencies play in protecting various farm investments (e.g., crop, stock)

86681D9D7FAB43F387A57908D5ABB38C.description: Generate a list of who (e.g., insurance agencies, Canadian Wheat Board, Canada Customs and Revenue Agency, financial institutions) would need to access farm records and discuss the purpose (e.g., financing, tax returns, farm programs, crop insurance) for granting access.

1CB4FEC3259D48A6862D025338091FCF.description: Investigate forms of record keeping that address specific needs of the agriculture industry.

C8A0293FAAC141B7BEFCBD95602EF4B7.description: Investigate the potential consequences of inaccurate bookkeeping.

0F8315D3A2C54E6BB4EBAE050C0D1A5B.description: Explain why farm records are required.

FF44C89F3E7E497D86BF77590B491B5D.description: Assess the impact of accurate record keeping in the agricultural industry.

FA1534523A9A4F4F9B3847AF32D5CD92.description: Calculate the amount and record the entry for a deferred expense when incurred.

5244AABE257C47D4BF7D07C1061F6240.description: Record an entry to pay cash on a deferred expense.

53A103971E414E4BAFD9048CBBD3C9CA.description: Calculate the amounts and record the entry for deferred revenue when earned.

029E7E6610954CD1B6346B2793568E08.description: Record an entry to receive cash on deferred revenue.

57DD6A47772A4920A6398D45D6DD7F67.description: Record the entries for accrued expense including reversing entry and payment on a note payable with accrued interest.

EEF8B1F7AEA5447B83DBF9D3195A3024.description: Calculate the interest expense owed on a note payable for the fiscal period, and record the adjusting entry for the accrued expense.

2A10B6E3B0634A4EBF078399B8026EFB.description: Record entries for accrued revenue including reversing entry and receipt of payment on a note receivable with accrued interest.

E02BFD9856E44A04A53983531A28BC35.description: Calculate the accrued interest earned on a note receivable in the fiscal period, and record the adjusting entry for the accrued interest revenue.

28DDD6EAB19B43F39EE772B96E4B1E3F.description: Define accounting terms and concepts related to accruals such as accrual, deferral, reversing entry, accrued expense, accrued interest, expense, deferred revenue and deferred expense.

7B0869B833EA4CF5AD10BCC7495AF34E.description: Examine entries related to accrued and deferred revenue and expenses.

96CB79E7F31D449EADDF165ED1C3215D.description: Account for a dishonored promissory note receivable.

1782114758DA49A3B336326DCB32BDA7.description: Account for the collection or payment of promissory notes.

DACE7974B1524B95B8A5D30C51F02E17.description: Calculate the interest or expense on promissory notes.

72053F594CD14D78AA0A90456D56A469.description: Calculate the maturity date of promissory notes.

13423FA644474A38A0F62DAEC8534211.description: Record the acceptance of a note as receivable or payable.

D54F434AD1324FB1AB73AF3475705787.description: Define accounting terms and concepts such as note payable, note receivable, maker of a note, payee, principal, interest rate, maturity date, term, maturity value, interest income, interest expense and dishonored note related to promissory notes

F305D92CCC7049D08041D12EBA5B2AA3.description: Analyze and record entries related to promissory notes.

EB0699CE690B46A2BDC55071B027580F.description: Differentiate between three methods (i.e., First-In, First-Out [FIFO], LastIn, Last-Out [LILO] and Weighted Average) for valuing inventory when reporting net income and total assets.

4618A363C28242B98DDE08CFCC018636.description: Describe and calculate three methods of valuing merchandise inventory including First-In, First-Out (FIFO), Last-In, Last-Out (LILO) and Weighted Average

5A529FDC91C24A2E9EBD41E68D3E2B29.description: Examine merchandise included in counting inventory (e.g., merchandise in transit, merchandise on consignment).

6EFEFC88D0574BC9B0ABD67B0C1107B7.description: Identify accounts affected by merchandise inventory and used in calculating cost of goods sold.

F308048E52E5469BA70BAFBA5F6AA34B.description: Distinguish between periodic and perpetual inventory and explain the conditions under which each type of inventory may be advantageous.

F74D46395DB541CC8A04CA73212A18A4.description: Define terms related to pricing of inventory such as stock record, stock ledger, Last-In, Last-Out(LILO) and First-In, First-Out (FIFO).

ED8B4523C8C94A48BC0CE3F4564A0579.description: Examine the impact (e.g., accessibility, global markets, e-business, working from home) of technology on business.

2B86170D4A3C4A64AD763BE17DDA7ABB.description: Defend the need for security systems, data protection and backup for accounting records.

A3B261AC29D944C7A5BF33DB207656F7.description: Generate a list of considerations (e.g., security of data, affordability, updates, required forms) when implementing accounting technology in a business

1D677EF2B69B434E836B2D9DEE734662.description: Research digital currency and discuss how it impacts businesses.

0BDD27B114184279B5368235E37EE7E8.description: Create a mock business plan and utilize technology to generate the financial operations of a business following the accounting cycle.

4CC897218B2348E29816892C8016A8E8.description: Implement individual steps of the accounting cycle of a business using accounting software.

1C53514B8F5C4EE59AB45EAF3495727E.description: Discuss the benefits and limitations of accounting software and apps.

FF7E28119ECD41F9B397B09C94408646.description: Investigate the impact of technology on accounting.

370C1D63FFC041D0B8212FCA6D413756.description: Examine the performance earnings and efficiency analysis and describe how they support management decision making.

C2035A80DA38485A80A39ABA7A46CDA7.description: Analyze financial statements and express the strengths and weaknesses of a business using ratios (e.g., current, quick or acid test, inventory turnover, debt and equity, return on owners’ equity, markup and return on sales).

5625670153A343269E45E6F8B59EEB70.description: Investigate how a manager would interpret trends and changes (e.g., a slight increase/ decrease in net sales from one month to another).

EACD9D18B26B4A4C829A3A591996078F.description: Analyze financial statements and express trends and changes using comparative balance sheets and comparative income statements.

E6F0EE5286E94217943F5109C4DB6781.description: Review what information financial statements provide and to whom financial statements may be of use.

80C51EFFC028451A9184255D00157358.description: Examine and outline the purpose of financial statement analysis in management accounting.

0599DFD6BE3940B384C2D47AEAF99760.description: Justify how financial statement analysis assists management with decision-making.

FFE13A371A3F4ECDB0FDE50E442F9BC1.description: Financial Statement Analysis in Management Accounting (Core)

FAF44F3C17564A559365FE45FEDD833E.description: Compare and outline the differences between a master budget and a flexible budget using what-if questions to observe changes in net income/loss, using variations in selling price, fixed costs, variable administration expense.

94A5ADBE8F8A48C2AE63E50C02680B8D.description: Differentiate and describe the variances (e.g., manager’s performance or because of production/ market/ economic conditions) between budgeted and actual data that require further investigation.

3A0775BB80AD4DC290E08D4C47687142.description: Organize and construct a budgeted income statement and budgeted balance sheet based on budget information.

09EE2D2466864CA497870440940A1E3A.description: Identify and present the contributions of five types of budgets including sales, purchases, cost of goods manufactured, selling and administrative expense and cash to the master budget as part of the profit planning process.

6948F744FFF14BE2AEBDF527E8DC57BD.description: Define the functions, goals, purposes and advantages of a budget and the budgeting process.

2C18FC4476794C0790E995D42246F93E.description: Examine how budgets assist in profit planning.

F23EA841E62A40DDB5663D4CC999A976.description: Compute and explain how changes in sales levels affect contribution margin and net income.

CA5624D4FB604239B8C7A40911DCA254.description: Analyze various scenarios by applying the CVP equations to determine their application to the contribution approach of an income statement.

E3E043B851E84198BA35D66DB4F607A9.description: Apply the CVP equations (e.g., breakeven sales volume = fixed costs ÷ contribution margin) to analyze various scenarios to determine their application to the contribution approach of an income statement.

98F356509083442DBF10635FE5CEB450.description: Examine how cost-volume-profit (CVP) analysis connects the relationship of product prices, volume or activity levels, variable costs per unit and total fixed costs.

A7309CBCA5CE4440B5B58AFF49660847.description: Calculate the breakeven point in units and sales and discuss how managers would use the breakeven point.

01B3731D23D14C9FA8890B89F95647DD.description: Define the breakeven point to be when sales revenue is equal to total costs.

A5125DC19F60490F8DB9583DB2873255.description: Create an income statement detailing the contribution margin.

11FCE7916888441C842C48139354529F.description: Compare an income statement detailing the contribution margin to the traditional income statement and explain how changes in sales levels affect contribution margin and net income.

39532187877E44D19B535DF9F076FA9B.description: Determine a mixed costs analysis using the high-low method and the scatter graph method.

5B3FAB1591C6439FBBED0B013613B034.description: Distinguish costs as being fixed or variable and describe how a manager may use this information.

7188D791498C4F89A246ECBCF6F07B11.description: Discuss factors such as prices of products, volume of sales or production, per unit variable costs, total fixed costs and mix of products sold that a manager considers when making management decisions.

2CA16402D79147129ACF47E099BA3C8C.description: Evaluate the factors a manager considers when making management decisions.

B3B63975AAA24E54A76F8FF1B82DAEDE.description: Differentiate cost into two categories (i.e., manufacturing costs and nonmanufacturing costs) to be used in management analysis.

CCA8B74370074FC5A284127E6CEEEFD9.description: Define cost accounting and explain how it relates to management accounting and financial accounting

6F0B5C5E47B1483DBC82F661CAE97E66.description: Investigate calculating, controlling and reporting costs of doing business.

7ED21F189E9D49579A8618A42F0E34AD.description: Create a simulation that will evaluate whether or not an individual is an effective manager.

1DE40064EC0B42A4BFF5DA7381BE8FD3.description: Design a set of interview questions that could be used to interview for a manager position.

EC851B7672844E59910A24AC21F61E55.description: Identify and evaluate skills needed to fulfill management roles.

E50452400C8A412AB70A3885862C7A55.description: Identify and evaluate a range of management styles.

48B51C06D1884FC0AD31CEF88487FD85.description: Identify and explain the management functions of planning, organizing, budgeting, forecasting and decision making

9E56408594E84DB0A52DE186DD897AFD.description: Differentiate between management and financial accounting

606BA740308C4AC1BB10A35BB0DC0FB6.description: Analyze and describe characteristics of management accounting.

2F5E6391C90B4C96B31993660AA2092C.description: Investigate nonmonetary aspects of management accounting.

5BF9F6F45C5C4F3CBE98CD51E317EA2E.description: Discuss how economic conditions may affect job prospects in the accounting industry

336E42068E58464A8A688A1613BDE2DC.description: Critique skills and interests that would enhance career choices (e.g., a focus on accounting practices specific to the agricultural community).

66CB017B6D1B482E80964A89C88F6F5E.description: Design interview questions that could be used for an accounting position.

800068FA63194188BD2C3D7B0E6397EA.description: Discuss how accounting professionals apply and adhere to different accounting standards depending on the type of entity (e.g., publicly accountable enterprise [IFRS], private enterprise [ASPE], not for profit organization [NPO], public sector entity [PSAB]) in which they are employed.

AC5DCCCCF73B4460A6B5F1D78B32BFAA.description: Reflect upon one’s suitability or non-suitability for a specific occupation in the accounting industry.

E292CD2C9E7F42DEA9EE68B337C32844.description: Research different specializations in the accounting field such as business analyst, controller, financial accounting, managerial accounting and forensic accounting.

9ACE4A6E83414E308049913B0D0BF52F.description: Investigate career opportunities in the accounting industry.
